Encapsulations for In-band OAM Data Encapsulations for In-situ OAM Data
draft-brockners-inband-oam-transport-01 draft-brockners-inband-oam-transport-02
Abstract Abstract
In-band operation, administration and maintenance (OAM) records In-situ operation, administration and maintenance (OAM) records
operational and telemetry information in the packet while the packet operational and telemetry information in the packet while the packet
traverses a path between two points in the network. In-band OAM is traverses a path between two points in the network. In-situ OAM is
to complement current out-of-band OAM mechanisms based on ICMP or to complement current out-of-band OAM mechanisms based on ICMP or
other types of probe packets. This document outlines how in-band OAM other types of probe packets. This document outlines how in-situ OAM
data records can be transported in protocols such as NSH, Segment data records can be transported in protocols such as NSH, Segment
Routing, VXLAN-GPE, native IPv6 (via extension header), and IPv4. Routing, VXLAN-GPE, native IPv6 (via extension header), and IPv4.
Transport options are currently investigated as part of an Transport options are currently investigated as part of an
implementation study. This document is intended to only serve implementation study. This document is intended to only serve
informational purposes. informational purposes.

1. Introduction 1. Introduction
This document discusses transport mechanisms for "in-band" operation, This document discusses transport mechanisms for "in-situ" operation,
administration, and maintenance (OAM) data records. In-band OAM administration, and maintenance (OAM) data records. In-situ OAM
records OAM information within the packet while the packet traverses records OAM information within the packet while the packet traverses
a particular network domain. The term "in-band" refers to the fact a particular network domain. The term "in-situ" refers to the fact
that the OAM data is added to the data packets rather than is being that the OAM data is added to the data packets rather than is being
sent within packets specifically dedicated to OAM. A discussion of sent within packets specifically dedicated to OAM. A discussion of
the motivation and requirements for in-band OAM can be found in the motivation and requirements for in-situ OAM can be found in
[draft-brockners-inband-oam-requirements]. Data types and data [I-D.brockners-inband-oam-requirements]. Data types and data formats
formats for in-band OAM are defined in for in-situ OAM are defined in [I-D.brockners-inband-oam-data].
[draft-brockners-inband-oam-data].
This document outlines transport encapsulations for the in-band OAM This document outlines transport encapsulations for the in-situ OAM
data defined in [draft-brockners-inband-oam-data]. This document is data defined in [I-D.brockners-inband-oam-data]. This document is to
to serve informational purposes only. As part of an in-band OAM serve informational purposes only. As part of an in-situ OAM
implementation study different protocol encapsulations for in-band implementation study different protocol encapsulations for in-situ
OAM data are being explored. Once data formats and encapsulation OAM data are being explored. Once data formats and encapsulation
approaches are settled, protocol specific specifications for in-band approaches are settled, protocol specific specifications for in-situ
OAM data transport will address the standardization aspect. OAM data transport will address the standardization aspect.
The data for in-band OAM defined in [draft-brockners-inband-oam-data] The data for in-situ OAM defined in [I-D.brockners-inband-oam-data]
can be carried in a variety of protocols based on the deployment can be carried in a variety of protocols based on the deployment
needs. This document discusses transport of in-band OAM data for the needs. This document discusses transport of in-situ OAM data for the
following protocols: following protocols:
o IPv6 o IPv6
o IPv4
o VXLAN-GPE o VXLAN-GPE
o NSH o NSH
o Segment Routing (IPv6 and MPLS) o Segment Routing (IPv6 and MPLS)
This list is non-exhaustive, as it is possible to carry the in-band This list is non-exhaustive, as it is possible to carry the in-situ
OAM data in several other protocols and transports. OAM data in several other protocols and transports.
A feasibility study of in-band OAM is currently underway as part of A feasibility study of in-situ OAM is currently underway as part of
the FD.io project [FD.io]. The in-band OAM implementation study the FD.io project [FD.io]. The in-situ OAM implementation study
should be considered as a "tool box" to showcase how "in-band" OAM should be considered as a "tool box" to showcase how "in-situ" OAM
can complement probe-packet based OAM mechanisms for different can complement probe-packet based OAM mechanisms for different
deployments and packet transport formats. For details, see the open deployments and packet transport formats. For details, see the open
source code in the FD.io [FD.io]. source code in the FD.io [FD.io].

3. In-Band OAM Metadata Transport in IPv6 3. In-Band OAM Metadata Transport in IPv6
This mechanisms of in-band OAM in IPv6 complement others proposed to This mechanisms of in-situ OAM in IPv6 complement others proposed to
enhance diagnostics of IPv6 networks, such as the IPv6 Performance enhance diagnostics of IPv6 networks, such as the IPv6 Performance
and Diagnostic Metrics Destination Option described in and Diagnostic Metrics Destination Option described in
[I-D.ietf-ippm-6man-pdm-option]. The IP Performance and Diagnostic [I-D.ietf-ippm-6man-pdm-option]. The IP Performance and Diagnostic
Metrics Destination Option is destination focused and specific to Metrics Destination Option is destination focused and specific to
IPv6, whereas in-band OAM is performed between end-points of the IPv6, whereas in-situ OAM is performed between end-points of the
network or a network domain where it is enabled and used. network or a network domain where it is enabled and used.
A historical note: The idea of IPv6 route recording was originally A historical note: The idea of IPv6 route recording was originally
introduced by [draft-kitamura-ipv6-record-route] back in year 2000. introduced by [I-D.kitamura-ipv6-record-route] back in year 2000.
With IPv6 now being generally deployed and new concepts such as With IPv6 now being generally deployed and new concepts such as
Segment Routing [I-D.ietf-spring-segment-routing] being introduced, Segment Routing [I-D.ietf-spring-segment-routing] being introduced,
it is imperative to further mature the operations, administration, it is imperative to further mature the operations, administration,
and maintenance mechanisms available to IPv6 networks. and maintenance mechanisms available to IPv6 networks.
The in-band OAM options translate into options for an IPv6 extension The in-situ OAM options translate into options for an IPv6 extension
header. The extension header would be inserted by either a host header. The extension header would be inserted by either a host
source of the packet, or by a transit/domain-edge node. source of the packet, or by a transit/domain-edge node. If the
addition of the in-situ OAM Hop-by-Hop Option header would lead to
the packet exceeding the MTU of the domain an error should be
reported. The methods and procedures of how the error is reported
are outside the scope of this document. Likewise if an ICMPv6
forwarding error occurs between encapsulating and decapsulating
nodes, the node generating the ICMPv6 error should strip the in-situ
OAM Hop-by-Hop Option header before sending the ICMPv6 message to the
source.
3.1. In-band OAM in IPv6 Hop by Hop Extension Header 3.1. In-situ OAM in IPv6 Hop by Hop Extension Header
This section defines in-band OAM for IPv6 transport. In-band OAM This section defines in-situ OAM for IPv6 transport. In-situ OAM
data is transported as an IPv6 hop-by-hop extension header. data is transported as an IPv6 hop-by-hop extension header.

3.1.2. Procedure at the Ingress Edge to Insert the In-band OAM Header 3.1.2. Procedure at the Ingress Edge to Insert the In-situ OAM Header
In an administrative domain where in-band OAM is used, insertion of In an administrative domain where in-situ OAM is used, insertion of
the in-band OAM header is enabled at the required edge nodes by means the in-situ OAM header is enabled at the required edge nodes (i.e. at
of configuration. the encapsulating/decapsulating nodes) by means of configuration.
Such a config SHOULD allow selective enablement of in-band OAM header Such a configuration SHOULD allow selective enablement of in-situ OAM
insertion for a subset of traffic (e.g., one or several "pipes"). header insertion for a subset of traffic (e.g., one or several
"pipes").
Further the ingress edge node should be aware of maximum size of the Further the ingress edge node should be aware of maximum size of the
header that can be inserted. Details on how the maximum size/size of header that can be inserted. Details on how the maximum size/size of
the in-band OAM domain are retrieved are outside the scope of this the in-situ OAM domain are retrieved are outside the scope of this
document. document.

is enabled to process in-band OAM data it performs the following: is enabled to process in-situ OAM data it performs the following:
k = number of node data that this node can allocate k = number of node data that this node can allocate
if (in-band OAM ext hbyh header is present) { if (in-situ OAM ext hbyh ext-header is present) {
if (Segments Left > 0)) { if (Elements-left > 0)) {
populate node data at : populate node data at :
node_data_start[Segments Left] node_data_start[Elements-left]
Segments Left = Segments Left - 1 Elements-left = Elements-left - 1
} }
} }

5. In-situ OAM Metadata Transport in VXLAN-GPE
VXLAN-GPE [I-D.ietf-nvo3-vxlan-gpe] encapsulation is somewhat similar VXLAN-GPE [I-D.ietf-nvo3-vxlan-gpe] encapsulation is somewhat similar
to IPv6 extension headers in that a series of headers can be to IPv6 extension headers in that a series of headers can be
contained in the header as a linked list. The different in-band OAM contained in the header as a linked list. The different in-situ OAM
types are added as options within a new in-band OAM protocol header types are added as options within a new in-situ OAM protocol header
in VXLAN GPE. in VXLAN GPE. In an administrative domain where in-situ OAM is used,
insertion of the in-situ OAM protocol header in VXLAN GPE is enabled
at the VXLAN GPE tunnel endpoint which also serve as in-situ OAM
encapsulating/decapsulating nodes by means of configuration.

for IPv6 can be verified using the in-band OAM "Proof of Transit" for IPv6 can be verified using the in-situ OAM "Proof of Transit"
